displayModel.summary: Additional properties used to configure pooling profile.

operations.description: Allows executing one delete statement various times using different parameter bindings. This happens using one single Database statement, which has performance advantages compared to executing one single delete operation various times.

parameters.description: A List of Maps in which every list item represents a row to be inserted, and the map contains the parameter names as keys and the value the parameter is bound to.
parameters.name: bulkInputParameters

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.
parameters.name: transactionalAction

parameters.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.
parameters.name: queryTimeout

parameters.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout
parameters.name: queryTimeoutUnit

parameters.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.
parameters.name: fetchSize

parameters.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.
parameters.name: maxRows

parameters.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed
parameters.name: sql

parameters.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values
parameters.name: parameterTypes

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy

operations.description: Selects data from a database. Streaming is automatically applied to avoid preemptive consumption of such results, which may lead to performance and memory issues.

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.
parameters.name: transactionalAction

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of instances that will be initially be allowed to be kept in memory in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize. Default value is 100 instances.

This is by how much will the buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full. Default value is 100 instances.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
This is the maximum amount of instances that will be kept in memory. If more than that is required, then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.name: streamingStrategy

parameters.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.
parameters.name: queryTimeout

parameters.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout
parameters.name: queryTimeoutUnit

parameters.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.
parameters.name: fetchSize

parameters.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.
parameters.name: maxRows

parameters.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed
parameters.name: sql

parameters.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values
parameters.name: parameterTypes

parameters.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.
parameters.name: inputParameters

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make

operations.name: select

operations.description:
Invokes a Stored Procedure on the database.

When the stored procedure returns one or more ResultSet instances, streaming is automatically applied to avoid preemptive consumption of such results, which may lead to performance and memory issues.

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: The type of joining action that operations can take regarding transactions.
parameters.name: transactionalAction

parameters.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

description.value: This is the amount of memory that will be allocated in order to consume the stream and provide random access to it. If the stream contains more data than can be fit into this buffer, then it will be expanded by according to the bufferSizeIncrement attribute, with an upper limit of maxInMemorySize.

This is by how much will be buffer size by expanded if it exceeds its initial size. Setting a value of zero or lower will mean that the buffer should not expand, meaning that a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised when the buffer gets full.
This is the maximum amount of memory that will be used. If more than that is used then a STREAM_MAXIMUM_SIZE_EXCEEDED error will be raised. A value lower or equal to zero means no limit.
The unit in which all these attributes are expressed
Defines the maximum memory that the stream should use to keep data in memory. If more than that is consumed then it will start to buffer the content on disk.
The unit in which maxInMemorySize is expressed

This configuration allows the input stream to be read only once. It will not allow to seek randomly which will limit the transformations that DW can perform on this stream. Use this option for use cases which just require moving data around from one system to another to get optimum performance.

parameters.name: streamingStrategy

parameters.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.
parameters.name: queryTimeout

parameters.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout
parameters.name: queryTimeoutUnit

parameters.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.
parameters.name: fetchSize

parameters.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.
parameters.name: maxRows

parameters.description: The text of the SQL query to be executed
parameters.name: sql

parameters.description: Allows to optionally specify the type of one or more of the parameters in the query. If provided, you're not even required to reference all of the parameters, but you cannot reference a parameter not present in the input values
parameters.name: parameterTypes

parameters.description:
A Map which keys are the name of an input parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.
parameters.name: inputParameters

parameters.description:
A Map which keys are the name of a parameter to be set on the JDBC prepared statement which is both input and output.

Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: where id = :myParamName)).

The map's values will contain the actual assignation for each parameter.
parameters.name: inOutParameters

parameters.description: A list of output parameters to be set on the JDBC prepared statement. Each parameter should be referenced in the sql text using a semicolon prefix (E.g: call multiply(:value, :result))
parameters.name: outputParameters

parameters.description: Indicates when to make auto-generated keys available for retrieval.
parameters.name: autoGenerateKeys

parameters.description: List of column indexes that indicates which auto-generated keys to make available for retrieval.
parameters.name: autoGeneratedKeysColumnIndexes

parameters.description: List of column names that indicates which auto-generated keys should be made available for retrieval.
parameters.name: autoGeneratedKeysColumnNames

parameters.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed
parameters.name: target

parameters.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable
parameters.name: targetValue

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

displayModel.summary: Triggers a message per each row in a table

messageSources.description:
Selects from a table at a regular interval and generates one message per each obtained row.

Optionally, watermark and id columns can be provided. If a watermark column is provided, the values taken from that column will be used to filter the contents of the next poll, so that only rows with a greater watermark value are returned. If an id column is provided, this component will automatically make sure that the same row is not picked twice by concurrent polls

parameters.description: The name of the table to select from
parameters.name: table

displayModel.summary: The name of the column used for watermark

parameters.description: The name of the column to use for watermark. Values taken from this column will be used to filter the contents of the next poll, so that only rows with a greater watermark value are processed.
parameters.name: watermarkColumn

displayModel.summary: The name of the column to consider as row ID

parameters.description: The name of the column to consider as row ID. If provided, this component will make sure that the same row is not processed twice by concurrent polls.
parameters.name: idColumn

parameters.description: The name of the configuration to be used to execute this component
parameters.name: config-ref

parameters.description: The type of beginning action that sources can take regarding transactions.
parameters.name: transactionalAction

parameters.description: The type of transaction to create. Availability will depend on the runtime version.
parameters.name: transactionType

parameters.description: Whether this source should only be executed on the primary node when runnning in Cluster
parameters.name: primaryNodeOnly

parameters.description: Configures the scheduler that triggers the polling
parameters.name: schedulingStrategy

parameters.description: Defines a policy for processing the redelivery of the same message

description.value: The maximum number of times a message can be redelivered and processed unsuccessfully before triggering process-failed-message
The secure hashing algorithm to use. If not set, the default is SHA-256.
Defines which strategy is used to identify the messages.
Whether to use a secure hash algorithm to identify a redelivered message
Defines one or more expressions to use to determine when a message has been redelivered. This property may only be set if useSecureHash is false.
The object store where the redelivery counter for each message is going to be stored.

parameters.name: redeliveryPolicy

parameters.description: Indicates the minimum amount of time before the JDBC driver attempts to cancel a running statement. No timeout is used by default.
parameters.name: queryTimeout

parameters.description: A TimeUnit which qualifies the #queryTimeout
parameters.name: queryTimeoutUnit

parameters.description: Indicates how many rows to fetch from the database when rows are read from a resultSet. This property is required when streaming is true; in that case a default value (10) is used.
parameters.name: fetchSize

parameters.description: Sets the limit for the maximum number of rows that any ResultSet object generated by this message processor can contain for the given number. If the limit is exceeded, the excess rows are silently dropped.
parameters.name: maxRows

parameters.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

description.value: How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

parameters.name: reconnectionStrategy

messageSources.name: listener

parameters.description: The identifier of this element used to reference it in other components
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

description.value: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.
A scalar time value for the maximum amount of time a dynamic configuration instance should be allowed to be idle before it's considered eligible for expiration
A time unit that qualifies the maxIdleTime attribute

parameters.name: expirationPolicy

externalLibraryModels.name: JDBC Driver
externalLibraryModels.description: A JDBC driver which supports connecting to the Database

connectionProviders.name: data-source

parameters.description: Provides a way to configure database connection pooling.

parameters.description: Specifies non-standard column types

parameters.description: Reference to a JDBC DataSource object. This object is typically created using Spring. When using XA transactions, an XADataSource object must be provided.

description.value: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy
The reconnection strategy to use
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make

If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread

externalLibraryModels.name: Derby JDBC Driver
externalLibraryModels.description: A JDBC driver which supports connecting to a Derby Database

connectionProviders.name: derby
connectionProviders.description: Creates connections to a Derby database

parameters.description: Provides a way to configure database connection pooling.
parameters.name: poolingProfile

parameters.description: Specifies non-standard column types
parameters.name: columnTypes

parameters.description: The transaction isolation level to set on the driver when connecting the database.
parameters.name: transactionIsolation

parameters.description: Indicates whether or not the created datasource has to support XA transactions. Default is false.
parameters.name: useXaTransactions

parameters.description: Name of the database
parameters.name: database

parameters.description: Specifies where Derby should look for the database. The available options are: 'directory', 'memory', 'classpath' and 'jar'.
parameters.name: subsubProtocol

parameters.description: Indicates if the database should be created if it does not exist.
parameters.name: create

parameters.description: Specifies a list of custom key-value connectionProperties for the config.
parameters.name: connectionProperties

parameters.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

description.value: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy
The reconnection strategy to use
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
How many reconnection attempts to make
How often (in ms) to reconnect
If false, the reconnection strategy will run in a separate, non-blocking thread
